author: jtrube
title: Cardano Candy-Pop CNFT Giveaway
description: There is a largely untapped resource of individuals who are casually aware of Cardano but do not actively participate in the community.

f6_assessments.q0: While this is a thoughtful project aimed at expanding the community by overcoming the first transaction barrier, the proposal is likely more appropriate in the New Member Onboarding Challenge as it relates to "participation in the Cardano community."  Overall, as it relates to the information presented, I think the idea to engage new community members is important, but I'm not convinced that CNFTs are the correct engagement tool, and the author presents no evidence or explanation for this methodology.
f6_assessments.q1: The author presents his qualifications with a background of high profile client work, although little in-depth information is presented about himself or his collaborators.  He also mentions the "cost of ADA at the time of minting" as a potential challenge in delivering this solution, which is might not be relevant when considering that minting is generally a fixed cost in ADA, and this proposal is requesting funding to execute that process.  He has also budgeted $7000 for minting 1000 CNFTs (an average cost of $7/CNFT) even though the minting and transfer cost combined would likely only total just over $0.3 for each, indicating ADA price would need to be more than 20x higher than it is today in order for the price to have any affect on the budgets presented in this proposal.  The timeline is present but basic.
f6_assessments.q2: The author's metrics for auditability mainly consist of "monitoring," "testing," and "measuring" with the overall success measured by transactions - apparently up to 1000 as this is the number of CNFTs they want to distribute.  The artwork sample presented offers not enough detail to evaluate the style, theme, or plan for this art series, and based on an average cost of $38/CNFT, the project would need to deliver a high level of perceived value to a small community, which would be very difficult to evaluate from an auditing perspective.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses a marketing pull-through problem which needs to be solved that the Misc. Challenge is best suited for. Creating a desirable NFT gift / giveaway removes the cost barrier to entry for someone who's never interacted with Cardano before.
f6_assessments.q1:
Over 10 yrs experience with luxury brand event production and content creation shows the project will be handled by a professional. However, it would help to validate the experience claims if there were professional links or documentation provided to showcase the person and their experience. Ex: linkedin or similar, relevant social media handles, résumé or CV to show there are real people behind the team member names listed in proposal.  The plan set forth is very simple and easy to understand. A little more detail behind any initial ideas or possible NFT design strategy would be useful. It would be interesting to know where the name Candy-Pop came from and if the free NFT's will be connected to a future game. Any initial ideas for how the finished NFT's will be launched and given away would be helpful as well. Does the potential CNFT receiver have to do the work and enter a contest to win? Will it be a cross-promotion with another project where the CNFT's will be airdropped to current holders of an already established community? Or will the project build up a discord of it's own community members who are excited to receive these free CNFT's to gift to their non-crypto or Cardano curious friends (and become mini CNFT ambassadors in an organic way)?

Also important to note: The amount requested is $38,000 for a total of 1000 CNFT's being given away. The cost to acquire a new CNFT wallet holder is $38 each. In addition, the free ADA minting fee of $7000 for only 1000 free CNFT's is rather high. A reference to which minting service the proposer is using would be helpful in addition to a sliding scale showing what the minting price would be at different ADA prices.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has an easy to read roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement. However, a little more detail on some of the roadmap and milestone elements would be helpful since there is not very much information to reference elsewhere in the proposal. Ex: What would auditing traffic and transactions look like since this is free giveaway. Also, clarification on what defines a unique wallet is needed in order to understand how it will be communicated to the public and tracked. A few questions to consider: How will the CNFT giveaways ensure they are truly going to brand new wallet holders instead of those who already hold CNFT's since different wallet addresses (no matter if they already hold CNFT's or not) can be considered unique from each other? Will the giveaways all be given away in the 3rd month or across a longer time period?

f6_assessments.q0:
It is unclear what is the added value to Cardano ecosystem based on the identified problem and the provided solution to the problem. ("(...) to encourage participation in the greater Cardano community." - what is the meaning of this statement, what kind of participation will be expected for this type of activity?)

The main KPI is defined in a vague manner ("number of transactions" - what kind of transactions?) and is unclear what is to be achieved.
f6_assessments.q1:
There are no traits and references about the experience of the team members just a couple of unsupported, by evidences, statements so it is unclear what is the area of expertize for each team member.

The budget is broken down into identifiable items but some of them are presented in a vague manner ("KYC database and check Solutions + misc" what is the meaning of this and why a KYC is necessary for this giveaway?). It is recommended to split the amount as a multiplier of working hours (if any) and hourly cost.

There is a timeline defined with achievable milestones but it looks too narrow to achieve the goals of the proposals. (a testing stage is also needed)

The proposer has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation. (what if there won't be any demand for this giveaway?)

It is not clear if the CNFTs will be minted using an already launched platform or using another method. ("Web development and technology" - what is the purpose of this stage? what is to be delivered?)
f6_assessments.q2: There are insufficient info about the proposal to objectively assess its path to a successful implementations. The proposal, as it is, looks more line a concept than as a working product. It needs to be rephrased, with relevant details, to stand a chance for getting funded.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal brings up a topic that needs atention but the proposers doens't present a reasonable solution. The impact seems to be too small and there is a big risk of the project not working. The impact seems to be small because there aren't evidences in the proposal that prove the interest of people in the CNFT's or in the Cardano Community. Consequently, the risk of this proposal not causing impact to the Cardano Ecossystem is big. In addition, there are no metrics to show how the proposal articulates the project progress.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers show a timeline with the milestones and deadlines to achievement but they could have explained better what would be done in each phase and how, considering more the tasks details. The budget was very well explained and divided em smaller items. I think the budget is coherent due to the project phases and needs. The members team explanation is clear and relevant to the project, thinking mainly about the project marketing needs. About the risks, I sugested in the criterion of Impact that the proposers make a risk map to understand the size of it challenge they can find along the way and develop a plan to deal and mitigate any risk that  can come true.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal exposed the roadmap with milestones but could show with more details how the project would happen in the practice with a explanation of what and how would be done in each phase. The metrics and KPI's are coherent if we think about the amount of transactions done. But I think the proposers could add some KPI's about the number of new participants in the Cardano community that came from this specific project. This way is possible to audit the project progress and success.

solution: Develop and deploy an original brand campaign from Japan with free CNFTs to encourage participation in the greater Cardano community.
experience: Over a decade of event production and content creation in the Japanese market for clients such as Google, Porsche, Ralph Lauren, and more.
